types.html:
faire bon vivre

  1. (impersonal) to be good to live (somewhere), to be a good place to live
    Il fait bon vivre en Corse. ― Corsica is a good place to live.
    Il faisait bon vivre à Amsterdam. ― Amsterdam was a nice town to live in.
    Arlon est une ville où il fait bon vivre. ― Arlon is a nice town to live in.

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Not to be confused with faire bon.
trans: to be good to live , to be a good place to live

title: faire bon vivre
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /fɛʁ bɔ̃ vivʁ/
